universal_guidelines: Do not use gradients for text.
Ensure all interactive elements have data-testid attributes.
Use 'Manrope' for all headings and 'Inter' for body text.
Never use pure black (#000000). Use Slate-950 (#020617) instead.
Tables must have sticky headers for long lists.
Risk levels must always be color-coded (Red/Amber/Green).
Use Skeleton loaders for data fetching states.
Dashboard widgets must align to the grid; no jagged bottoms.
instructions_to_main_agent: You are building a Clinical Data Monitoring System. Focus on data density and clarity. The user needs to see 'High Risk' sites immediately. Use the 'Control Room' grid layout. Implement the Sidebar navigation. Use the provided image URLs for the login page and avatars. Ensure the 'Risk Analysis' logic is visually distinct using the defined color palette.
